text:
Real website from real Australian Government department.
<https://www.health.gov.au/initiatives-and-programs/covid-19-vaccines/is-it-true/is-it-true-can-covid-19-vaccines-connect-me-to-the-internet|https://www.health.gov.au/initiatives-and-programs/covid-19-vaccines/is-it-true/is-it-true-can-covid-19-vaccines-connect-me-to-the-internet>

attachments.title: Is it true? Can COVID-19 vaccines connect me to the internet?
attachments.text: COVID-19 vaccines do not – and cannot – connect you to the internet. Find out more below.
attachments.fallback: Australian Government Department of Health: Is it true? Can COVID-19 vaccines connect me to the internet?

elements.text: Real website from real Australian Government department.

text:
Logic behind why apparently sone people believe this.

Some medical implants connect to the internet (e.g. some form of monitors).

Some medical implants use hydrogels.

There is a bit of research suggesting that hydrogels could be useful in mRNA vaccines.
<https://www.fiercebiotech.com/research/mrna-vaccine-delivered-hydrogel-shows-promise-as-a-durable-cancer-immunotherapy|https://www.fiercebiotech.com/research/mrna-vaccine-delivered-hydrogel-shows-promise-as-a-durable-cancer-immunotherapy>
It has never been deployed on mRNA vaccines for covid (not even in experiments).

attachments.title: An mRNA vaccine delivered in hydrogel shows promise as a durable cancer immunotherapy
attachments.text: Scientists at China’s National center for Nanoscience and Technology have designed a hydrogel to deliver an mRNA vaccine with an immune-stimulating adjuvant. When injected into mice with melanoma, the vaccine stayed active for at least 30 days, inhibiting tumor growth and preventing metastasis.
attachments.fallback: FierceBiotech: An mRNA vaccine delivered in hydrogel shows promise as a durable cancer immunotherapy

text: Darn. Is there a timeline for when vaccines with internet functionality will be available? I'd rather wait for those ones.
